acme.title: ACMEプロトコル
acme.noAccountsDesc: 最初のACMEアカウントを作成してください
acme.noCertificatesDesc: ACMEで発行された証明書がここに表示されます
acme.enableAcmeServerDesc: ACMEによる自動証明書発行を許可
acme.enableLetsEncryptProxyDesc: Forward requests to Let's Encrypt with audit logging
acme.emailRequired: Required for Let's Encrypt account registration
acme.aboutAcmeDesc: ACME enables automated certificate issuance. Configure the server below, then use the directory URL with any ACME client (certbot, acme.sh, etc.).
acme.aboutAcmeInfo: ACME (Automatic Certificate Management Environment) enables automated certificate issuance. Compatible with certbot, acme.sh, and other ACME clients.
acme.letsEncryptProxyTip: Enable the LE Proxy to forward requests to Let's Encrypt while maintaining centralized audit logging and control.
acme.accountSecurityWarning: ACME accounts contain private keys. Deactivate or delete unused accounts to minimize security exposure.
acme.agreeToTerms: I agree to the ACME Terms of Service
acme.agreeToTermsRequired: You must agree to the Terms of Service
acme.contactEmailHelper: Contact email for certificate expiry notifications

scep.title: SCEPプロトコル
scep.challenge: チャレンジパスワード
scep.noRequestsDesc: Enrollment requests will appear here when devices request certificates via SCEP protocol
scep.selectRequest: Select a request to view details
scep.subject: Subject
scep.enableScepDesc: デバイスがSCEPで登録することを許可
scep.useThisUrl: Use this URL in client configuration
scep.caIdentifierHelp: Identifier sent to clients during GetCACaps
scep.autoApproveWarning: Auto-approve enabled. Ensure challenge passwords are securely distributed.
scep.scepDisabledDesc: Enable SCEP in Configuration tab to use challenge passwords.
scep.noCasAvailableDesc: Create a Certificate Authority first to configure SCEP challenge passwords
scep.aboutScepDesc: Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) enables automated certificate enrollment for devices like MDM-managed devices, network equipment, and IoT devices.
scep.mdmIntegrationDesc: Compatible with Microsoft Intune, Jamf Pro, VMware Workspace ONE, and other MDM solutions. Configure the SCEP URL and challenge password in your MDM profile.
scep.challengeSecurityDesc: Challenge passwords should be securely distributed. Consider using auto-approve only in trusted environments with proper network segmentation.

crlOcsp.title: CRL & OCSP
crlOcsp.subtitle: {{count}}個のアクティブなCRL
crlOcsp.createCAFirst: Create a CA first to manage CRLs
crlOcsp.crlDescription: Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs) contain serial numbers of revoked certificates. They are periodically published and cached by clients for offline verification.
crlOcsp.ocspVsCRLDescription: OCSP provides real-time revocation status checks. CRL is a periodic snapshot. Enable both for maximum compatibility with all clients and applications.
crlOcsp.cdpNoteDescription: Include CDP (CRL Distribution Point) and AIA (Authority Information Access) URLs in your CA settings to enable automatic revocation checking.
crlOcsp.includeURLsNote: Include these URLs in CA settings for automatic revocation checking.

trustStore.title: トラストストア
trustStore.noCertificates: 信頼された証明書なし
trustStore.subtitle: {{count}}件の証明書
trustStore.addCertificatesForChain: Add certificates to validate certificate chains
trustStore.selectToView: 証明書を選択して詳細を表示
trustStore.subject: Subject
trustStore.name: Name
trustStore.syncConfirm: This will import up to 50 certificates from the system CA bundle (/etc/ssl/certs). Continue?
trustStore.aboutTrustStoreDesc: The Trust Store contains certificates that are explicitly trusted for validating certificate chains. Add Root and Intermediate CAs here for chain verification.
trustStore.bestPracticesDesc: Only add certificates from trusted sources. Regularly review and remove expired or unnecessary certificates to maintain security.
trustStore.securityNoteDesc: Certificates in the Trust Store can validate any certificate chain. Be careful when adding third-party certificates.

export.allCertsDesc: Download all certificates in a single file

tools.title: 証明書ツール
tools.pasteHere: PEMコンテンツをここに貼り付け
tools.noResult: まだ結果がありません
tools.subtitle: SSL checker, decoders, converters and key matcher
tools.sslCheckerDesc: Check SSL certificate of a remote server
tools.converterDesc: Convert between PEM, DER, PKCS12, PKCS7
tools.keyMatcherDesc: Verify if key, certificate and CSR match
tools.supportsFormats: Supports: PEM, DER, CRT, CER, P12/PFX, P7B, KEY, CSR
tools.privateKeyFile: Private Key File (optional if included in input)
tools.pleaseProvideItem: Please provide at least one item to match
tools.pleaseUploadOrPaste: Please upload a file or paste content to convert
tools.privateKeyRequired: Private key is required for PKCS12 conversion
tools.helpDescription: A collection of SSL/TLS tools to help you troubleshoot, verify, decode and convert certificates.
tools.helpSslChecker: Enter a hostname to check its SSL certificate. Shows validity, expiry, cipher suite, TLS version, and any issues like mismatched hostnames or expired certificates.
tools.helpCsrDecoder: Paste a CSR (Certificate Signing Request) in PEM format to see its contents including subject, public key type/size, and any requested extensions like SANs.
tools.helpCertDecoder: Paste a certificate in PEM format to see all details: subject, issuer, validity dates, extensions, key usage, fingerprints, and more.
tools.helpKeyMatcher: Verify that a private key, certificate, and/or CSR belong together by comparing their public keys. Useful before installing certificates.
tools.helpConverter: Convert certificates and keys between formats: PEM ↔ DER, PEM → PKCS12 (requires key), PEM → PKCS7. Download the converted file directly.

settings.followSystemDesc: Automatically switch based on your OS settings
settings.layoutModeDesc: Control responsive layout behavior for smaller windows
settings.settingSavedInBrowser: This setting is saved in your browser and persists across sessions.
settings.autoBackupPasswordHelper: Password used to encrypt automatic backups
settings.noBackupsHint: Create a backup to protect your data
settings.restoreFromBackupDesc: Upload a .ucmbkp file to restore all data
settings.createBackupDesc: Create a backup containing all data (database, certificates, CAs, users, configuration). The backup will be encrypted with your password.
settings.encryptionPasswordHelper: Use a strong password - you'll need it to restore the backup
settings.restoreWarning: This will REPLACE ALL current data with the backup contents. This action cannot be undone.
settings.enterBackupPassword: Enter the password used to create the backup
settings.databaseResetDesc: Reset database to initial state. This will DELETE ALL certificates, CAs, users, and settings.
settings.useUcmCertificateDesc: Apply an existing certificate from UCM as the HTTPS certificate. Only valid certificates with private keys are shown.
settings.noValidCertificates: No valid certificates with private keys found. Issue a certificate first.
settings.regenerateCertificateDesc: Generate a new self-signed HTTPS certificate. The server will restart automatically.
settings.applyCustomCertificateDesc: Upload your own certificate and private key (PEM format).
settings.selectCertOrKeyFile: Select certificate or key file (PEM format)
settings.featureComingSoon: Feature coming soon: Upload custom HTTPS certificate
settings.updatesSubtitle: Check for and install UCM updates
